main event: Six bright red objects were seen moving up, down, and sideways in the sky near Kettering, Ohio on September 10, 1959.
interesting points: The objects were sharply outlined and had no particular arrangement.
The objects made no sound and disappeared by fading out of sight in the distance.
The witness indicated the objects could have been blinking lights of an aircraft, as the sighting was made in a location where many aircraft pass overhead.
The sighting occurred during twilight, and was likely an aircraft.
The local air force operations, flight service, weather service, and airport control tower reported nothing unusual in the area at the time.
